com.bigdata.journal

Class FileMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.journal.FileMetadata

  • public class FileMetadata
extends Object
    Helper object used when opening or creating journal file in any of the file-based modes.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • MAGIC

        public static final int MAGIC
        Magic value for journal (the root blocks have their own magic value).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERSION1

        public static final int VERSION1
        The original journal version number (version 1).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CURRENT_VERSION

        public static final int CURRENT_VERSION
        The current journal version number.

        Note: This could be used to create major versioning changes of the file structure. There is only one version to date.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • file

        public final File file
        The file that was opened.

      • writeCacheBufferCount

        public final int writeCacheBufferCount
        The #of write cache buffers to be used if the write cache is enabled.

      • readOnly

        public final boolean readOnly
        True iff the file was opened in a read-only mode.

      • OFFSET_ROOT_BLOCK0

        public static final int OFFSET_ROOT_BLOCK0
        Offset of the first root block in the file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OFFSET_ROOT_BLOCK1

        public static final int OFFSET_ROOT_BLOCK1
        Offset of the second root block in the file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • headerSize0

        public static final int headerSize0
        The size of the journal header, including MAGIC, version, and both root blocks. This is used as an offset when computing the index of a record in the journal.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • rootBlock

        public final IRootBlockView rootBlock
        The current root block. For a new file, this is "rootBlock0". For an existing file it is based on an examination of both root blocks.

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomAccessFile

        public RandomAccessFile getRandomAccessFile()
        The interface for IO performed on that file.

        Note: this method is only safe for use during the initial file create/open. It is not safe to use once a file has been closed, whether directly or by an interrupt during an IO operation.

      • createInstance

        public static FileMetadata createInstance(Properties properties,
                                          boolean isScaleout,
                                          long quorumToken)
        Prepare a journal file for use by an IBufferStrategy. The file will be created if necessary as permitted and instructed by the specified Options. The root blocks will be created or read from the file and verified. A variety of interesting properties are set on the returned FileMetadata object.
